DataElement.preferredName: Non-Protocol Therapeutic Procedure Generalized Chlorhexidine Gluconate Administered Day Duration
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the number of days related to the acceptance of a widespread of the gluconate salt form of chlorhexidine not specified in a protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Non-Protocol Therapeutic Procedure Generalized Chlorhexidine Gluconate Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the acceptance of a widespread of the gluconate salt form of chlorhexidine not specified in a protocol.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Treatment not specified in a protocol.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: Treatment not specified in a protocol.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: Widespread; broadly dispersed.:The gluconate salt form of chlorhexidine, a biguanide compound used as an antiseptic agent with topical antibacterial activity. Chlorhexidine gluconate is positively charged and reacts with the negatively charged microbial cell surface, thereby destroying the integrity of the cell membrane. Subsequently, chlorhexidine gluconate penetrates into the cell and causes leakage of intracellular components leading to cell death. Since gram positive bacteria are more negatively charged, they are more sensitive to this agent.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: The gluconate salt form of chlorhexidine, a biguanide compound used as an antiseptic agent with topical antibacterial activity. Chlorhexidine gluconate is positively charged and reacts with the negatively charged microbial cell surface, thereby destroying the integrity of the cell membrane. Subsequently, chlorhexidine gluconate penetrates into the cell and causes leakage of intracellular components leading to cell death. Since gram positive bacteria are more negatively charged, they are more sensitive to this agent.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from CTEP to COG for by script Thu Jan 2 10:00:57 EST 2014

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the number of days during which an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours.:The period of time during which something continues.

Concepts.definition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
The period of time during which something continues.
